titleStmt.title: To the honourable the Knights, citizens and burgesses, in Parliament assembled. May it please your honours; the last sessions of Parliament I presented the Honourable the Commons in Parliament then sitting, with proposals for setting up a national land-bank in favour of the freeholders and trading part of the kingdom, ...
titleStmt.author: Briscoe, John, fl. 1695.

titleStmt.title: To the honourable the Knights, citizens and burgesses, in Parliament assembled. May it please your honours; the last sessions of Parliament I presented the Honourable the Commons in Parliament then sitting, with proposals for setting up a national land-bank in favour of the freeholders and trading part of the kingdom, ...
titleStmt.author: Briscoe, John, fl. 1695.

notesStmt.note: Dated and signed: Decemb. 2. 1695. John Briscoe.
Page 2 has title "A short account of the national land-bank."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
